reviews.text: Unmanned station. Little facilities beyond ticket machine, electronic boards and small waiting area. Only a few trains per hour

Batley train station is clean good parking accessible for disabled good information on trains ticket machine to purchase tickets however it can be hard to get a parking space but there is on-street parking luckily
There is a shopping centre walking distance from the rail station. There are also parks to walk in.

Batley is Very good place to live for Asian population.

Batley is a town in the Metropolitan Borough of Kirklees, West Yorkshire, England. It lies 7 miles south-east of Bradford, 7 miles south-west of Leeds and 1 mile north of Dewsbury, near the M62 motorway.

Batley includes the districts of Batley Carr, Carlinghow, Cross Bank, Hanging Heaton, Healey, Lamplands, Carlton Grange Mount Pleasant, Soothill, Staincliffe, Upper Batleyand White Lee.

As Batley shares boundaries with both Dewsbury and Heckmondwike, parts of Batley Carr, Hanging Heaton and Staincliffe are part of Dewsbury, while part of White Lee is in Heckmondwike. There is an area of Ossett known as Healey, which is identical in name to the Batley district of Healey; the Ossett area is sometimes referred to as "Healey Mills" due to the very large congregation of mills that once existed in that area.

Most famous for bed factories and Asian Food outlets and takeaways.
It's a good little station, does what it says on the tin, but rather tricky getting too woth kids on foot. Lovely astetics mind.
